alert.note: Alert for Clay; Fillmore; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued August 21 at 4:24AM CDT until August 23 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Multiple days of dangerously hot conditions with afternoon and early evening heat index values of 105 to over 110 degrees expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and east central and south central Nebraska, mainly along and southeast of a line extending from Phillipsburg Kansas to York Nebraska. * WHEN...Until 10 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Overnight temperatures will only fall into the 70s, providing only limited relief from the heat. South- southwesterly winds of 10 to 15 MPH are expected Monday through Wednesday, providing at least some degree of relief.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Fillmore; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster; York
